snippet: During a televised statement from the White House, the president lashed out at those who oppose gun limits by saying that their answer to such tragedies is more guns, not fewer.

byline.original: By GARDINER HARRIS and MICHAEL D. SHEAR

abstract: Pres Obama, responding angrily and with obvious frustration to gun massacre at Umpqua Community College in Roseburg, Ore, says he is powerless to stop another shooting and implores American voters to force lawmakers to enact national gun control; pleads with public and politicians to realize how numb the country has become to such tragedies and to wake up and take actions that will ensure all young Americans have a chance to grow up.
lead_paragraph: During a televised statement from the White House, the president lashed out at those who oppose gun limits by saying that their answer to such tragedies is more guns, not fewer.

headline.print_headline: ‘Save These Lives and Let These People Grow Up’
headline.main: Obama Condemns ‘Routine’ of Mass Shootings, Says U.S. Has Become Numb
